intro: Wahlenbergia longifolia var. corymbosa, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or rocky soils. It produces small, oval-shaped leaves and has a compact, bushy growth habit. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and coastal landscapes.
